Detailed Description

Definition of a set of connexions in order to waiting from events on the connexions.

Selector The selector maintains a set of connexions in order to wait for incomming data. A Selector object should have been fill in with connexion. Each added connexion is associated to a mask of event that could be treated. The type of the mask is SetKind that contains predefined constants. Moreover a connexion could be erased from the selector.

A thread of control could wait to acquire a connexion: the acquire method returns a pointer to a Connexion object that have received a kind of event (Read or Exception). The connexion should have been initialized and attached to a file descriptor. When the thread wants to release the connexion, it should replace the connexion into the Selector with the release method. Between an acquire and release calls to method, the returned Connexion object will never be returned to an other thread.

Warning:
the current implementation simplify the previous version where several thread may call acquire in order to process message. The current implementation assume that only one thread is blocked in the acquire method.

Member Function Documentation

Connexion* SOCKNET::Selector::acquire ( int  timeout = 60000  )  throw (ComFailure)

acquire Acquire a new active connexion. In case of success, returns a connexion with pending operation dependings of its set. An activate connexion is returned only once in an unlocked state. A null pointer (0) is returned if the timeout is reached or if no connexion is active on the choosen set(s).

Parameters:
t (IN) timeout in ms
Returns:
the connexion that has been activated or 0
Exceptions:
ComFailure in case of error
void SOCKNET::Selector::erase ( Connexion *  c  )  throw (InvalidArgumentError)

erase Erase a connexion from the acquire-able connexions Modification of the set of a selector should be done in a exclusive way by the caller(s).

Parameters:
c the pointer to the connexion
Exceptions:
InvalidArgumentError if c not in the selector object with the specify set v
